title: Can someone explain why this happens?
body:
For example, the enemy has 2 champs left. One Elise spider and one Big Shyvana. I have 3 champs left in the game.

Why is it possible, that every damn time, I lose because all my  champions attack Elise Spider instead of Big Shyvana!? Shyvana literally drains their health, but my champs decide to ignore her and hit the spider like a braindead r%%%%% so they die. While maybe when they would attack SHYVANA first they would not die.

This happens a lot. Not just with these champs. Oh, 2 star Jinx with 3 items shoots us completely to the graveyard, well lets all together focus 500000 HP Braum instead.

replies.body:
Champs attack whoever's closest.  Big Shyv jumps away and attacks at range, so your champs will attack the tiny spider that's 1 hex away.

Same with Braum.  Jinx is ranged, so they attack the closest instead.  It's classic backline/frontline tactics.

> Champs attack whoever's closest.  Big Shyv jumps away and attacks at range, so your champs will attack the tiny spider that's 1 hex away.
> 
> Same with Braum.  Jinx is ranged, so they attack the closest instead.  It's classic backline/frontline tactics.

Then why are they so braindead made.

> [{quoted}](name=Î•lin,realm=EUW,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=QAQYhF0K,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-08-30T19:26:23.377+0000)
>
> Then why are they so braindead made.

To create a classic frontline/backline tactic.  That's also why assassins exist: to reach the backline without going through the frontline.

That's also what sorcs are for.
